newsitem.title: GERMANY: Deutsche may have upped Vereinsbank stake - source.
newsitem.headline: Deutsche may have upped Vereinsbank stake - source.

text.p: Deutsche Bank AG appears to have increased its stake in rival Bayerische Vereinsbank AG, a banking source said on Monday.

There were indications that Deutsche last week bought more shares in Vereinsbank, thereby increasing its stake from the 5.21 percent level Deutsche disclosed in July, the source, who declined to be identified, told Reuters.
Vereinsbank shares on Friday jumped 0.67 marks or 1.24 percent to 54.62 marks in heavy trade, easily outperforming the DAX index of 30 blue-chip shares which rose just 0.25 percent.
The shares continued to rise on Monday, hitting a new year high of 55.20 marks in floor trade, up 0.58 marks or 1.1 percent.
A Deutsche Bank spokesman declined to comment, saying, "The bank generally does not comment on price movements."
A Vereinsbank spokesman said, "We do not know who is buying our shares."

Deutsche's stake disclosure in July fanned speculation that Germany faced a wave of bank mergers but chief executive Hilmar Kopper said in August the bank had no immediate plans to increase the stake.
He said the shareholding was aimed at deterring potential bidders for Vereinsbank.
Deutsche had staked a claim with the purchase, but a decision on whether to use the stake as a "strategic tool" may not be on the agenda for five, seven or 10 years, Kopper said.
Under German law, Deutsche has to disclose any increase in its stake to 10 percent or over.
Vereinsbank has officially welcomed the Deutsche's shareholding but the news has caused uncertainty among Vereinsbank staff.
